citation.title: Characterization of temperature sensitive influenza virus mutants defective in neuraminidase.

blogs.title: The neuraminidase of influenza virus
blogs.summary: The influenza virus particle is made up of the viral RNA genome wrapped in a lipid membrane (illustrated). The membrane, or envelope, contains three different kinds of viral proteins. The hemagglutinin molecule (HA, blue) attaches to cell receptors and ini

blogs.title: TWiV 223: EEEV and the serpent
blogs.summary:
Hosts: Vincent Racaniello, Alan Dove, and Kathy Spindler
Vincent, Alan, and Kathy discuss new influenza virus NA inhibitors, detection of EEEV antibody and RNA in snakes, and replication of the coronavirus EMC in human airway epithelial cell

author.name: This Week in Virology with Vincent Racaniello
author.description: This Week in Virology is a netcast about viruses - the kind that make you sick. Professors Vincent Racaniello, Dickson Despommier, Rich Condit and science writer Alan Dove and guests deconstruct viruses, how they cause illness, and how you can prevent infections.

blogs.title: TWiV 223: EEEV and the serpent
blogs.summary:
On episode #223 of the science show This Week in Virology, Vincent, Alan, and Kathy discuss new influenza virus NA inhibitors, detection of EEEV antibody and RNA in snakes, and replication of the coronavirus EMC in human airway epithelial cells.

blogs.title: TWiV 396: Influenza viruses with Peter Palese
blogs.summary: Host: Vincent Racaniello Guest: Peter Palese Vincent speaks with Peter Palese about his illustrious career in virology, from early work on neuraminidases to universal influenza virus vaccines.   Become a patron of TWiV! Links

author.name: This Week in Virology with Vincent Racaniello
author.description: This Week in Virology is a netcast about viruses - the kind that make you sick. Professors Vincent Racaniello, Dickson Despommier, Rich Condit and science writer Alan Dove and guests deconstruct viruses, how they cause illness, and how you can prevent infections.

wikipedia.title: Neuraminidase
wikipedia.summary: Neuraminidase enzymes are glycoside hydrolase enzymes that cleave the glycosidic linkages of neuraminic acids.
